sentences: Teame ise, kuhu minna, juhatajaid vaja pole.
Mina j채in noorelt 체ksip채ini maha... ei olnud mul 체htegi abimeest ega juhatajat..
context: The Estonian word 'juhataja' refers to a person who has the official responsibility of leading or managing an institution, company, organization, or meeting. It can be translated as leader, manager, director, or chairperson depending on the context. The word is derived from the verb 'juhatama' (to lead). Examples include pharmacy juhataja (pharmacy manager), club juhataja (club director), and koosoleku juhataja (meeting chairperson).
